alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:31PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Big Horn County through 600 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms extending from 9 miles west of Busby to 5 miles southeast of Hardin, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crow Agency, Busby, Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for south central Montana.
